tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a product page using the 8-point grid system, focusing on layout and visual hierarchy. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement target: +3 for UX Fundamentals

Write down 5 principles of usability from Tesler's Law and explain how they apply to your current design work. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/teslers-law/) Score improvement target: +2 for UX Fundamentals

Redesign a simple product page using the 8-point grid system, focusing on visual hierarchy and layout. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement target: +3 for UX Fundamentals

Create a list of 10 usability heuristics from the NNGroup and explain how they can be applied to your current design work. (Reference: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement target: +2 for UX Fundamentals

Create a simple wireframe of an error page using the 8-point grid system, focusing on clear communication and minimal cognitive load. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement target: +3 for UX Fundamentals

Write down 5 principles of aesthetic usability from Laws of UX and explain how they apply to your current design work. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/) Score improvement target: +2 for UX Fundamentals

Create a comprehensive design system document outlining the use of the 8-point grid system in your current projects. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement target: +3 for UX Fundamentals

Conduct a self-assessment of your product thinking and strategy skills, identifying areas for improvement and creating a plan to address them. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/product-thinking-and-strategy/) Score improvement target: +2 for Product Thinking & Strategy

resources.readup: As a Practitioner UX designer, you have a solid foundation in UX Fundamentals and User Research & Validation, but there's room for growth in Product Thinking & Strategy and Collaboration & Communication. By focusing on these areas and continually honing your skills, you can elevate your practice and drive more impactful design solutions.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Improving Product Thinking & Strategy through Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Developing a deeper understanding of user motivations and needs to inform design decisions.
practice_points: Conduct 3 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings on pain points, goals, and behaviors.
Create a personas document with 2-3 user profiles and their associated jobs-to-be-done, highlighting key motivations and pain points.
Develop a design brief for a new product feature that incorporates the user's job-to-be-done, including clear goals, metrics, and success criteria.

topics.name: Enhancing UI Craft & Visual Design through Aesthetic-Usability Effect
topics.summary: Applying principles of visual design to create an aesthetically pleasing and usable interface.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes with varying levels of visual hierarchy, color scheme, and typography, and test for usability using user interviews or A/B testing.
Develop a comprehensive style guide with color, typography, and spacing tokens, including examples of how to apply these principles in design decisions.
Design 2 interactive prototypes in Figma that incorporate the aesthetic-usability effect, including micro-interactions and visual feedback.

topics.name: Strengthening User Research & Validation through Empathy Mapping
topics.summary: Developing a deeper understanding of user emotions, needs, and behaviors to inform design decisions.
practice_points: Create 2 empathy maps for 1-2 users, highlighting their thoughts, feelings, and behaviors in relation to a specific product or service.
Conduct 2 usability testing sessions with participants using an empathy map as a guide, documenting findings on user behavior and pain points.
Develop a user research plan for a new project, including methods for data collection, analysis, and reporting.
